subject: RE: [junit] Loading XML file....
msgSnippet: I ran into this when moving from JUnit 3.2 to 3.5. Specifying the -noloading parameter when running the Swing GUI fixed it. It has to do with the class loader.
messageBody:
I ran into this when moving from JUnit 3.2 to 3.5.

Specifying the -noloading parameter when running the Swing GUI fixed it. It
has to do with the class loader. I'm no expert so I can't explain it but
there are lots of other people in this group who can.

The only problem is that you have to restart the tests if you change
anything and want to rerun them. You can't just click the run button again
because the changed classes will not load. I consider this a small price to
pay for the ability to run the tests.

Peter

-----Original Message-----
From: Dee Hauer
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Sent: 4/24/2001 3:41 PM
Subject: [junit] Loading XML file....

> Hello,
> Just to give you a quick background, I am new to JUnit and am also
> fairly new to Java, so bear with me!! Before JUnit, our company's
testing
> procedures consisted of importing an XML document, load it into our
> objects, and compare it against an expected results file. To display
the
> results, we utilize ExamDiff.
>
> With JUnit, we will be able to eliminate the majority of these types
of
> tests, but not completely. So, in my test case I added the
functionality
> of importing an XML document and comparing it against another file
using
> ExamDiff. I successfully ran my test using textui, but when I run my
test
> through swingui, I receive the following error message:
>
> 'Class org/xml/sax/InputSource violates loader constraints'
>
> Here is the stacktrace:
>
> java.lang.LinkageError: Class org/xml/sax/InputSource violates loader
> constraints
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:486)
> at
java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:111)
>
> at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:248)
> at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56)
> at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195)
> at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
> at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188)
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:297)
> at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:286)

> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:253)
> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:313)

> at
>
org.apache.xerces.readers.DefaultEntityHandler.startReadingFromDocument(
De
> faultEntityHandler.java:484)
> at
>
org.apache.xerces.framework.XMLParser.parseSomeSetup(XMLParser.java:305)
>
> at org.apache.xerces.framework.XMLParser.parse(XMLParser.java:947)

> at
>
org.apache.xerces.jaxp.DocumentBuilderImpl.parse(DocumentBuilderImpl.jav
a:
> 123)
>
> We are currently using xalan 2.0. If anyone has seen this same
situation,
> please help!!! Thanks in advance for your help!!
>
> Dee Hauer :-)
> International Decision Systems
